page.title: 01GAZETTEER OF TONG AREA
page.content:
This block is predominantly an undulating green belt lying between the industrial cities of Leeds, Bradford, Wakefield and Dewsbury. Two important main roads cross the area, the A58 trunk road Leeds to Halifax and the A 650 Bradford to Wakefield. The rural village of Tong occupies the centre of the block but three industrial villages of Gildersome, Birkenshaw and Driglington are partially included. There is still a large area covered by farmland but because most of the land is 500 feet above sea level it is mainly used for pasture.
A small industrial estate has grown up in the past ten years along the A650 at Westgate Hill. There are some older industries in the Gildersome area .
